summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Syria, reaffirms its commitment to Syria's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Demands full implementation of previous resolutions.

Extends decisions on humanitarian assistance for six months, until 10 January 2022, for the Bab al-Hawa border crossing, with a possible additional six-month extension subject to the Secretary-General's report.

Calls on Member States to address urgent needs of the Syrian people, particularly in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Welcomes humanitarian efforts, including early recovery projects, and calls on international agencies to support them.

Requests the Secretary-General to brief the Council monthly and provide regular reports on implementation of resolutions, compliance by all parties, and humanitarian assistance delivered through UN operations.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
